1.brief: to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to be (causatively, make) lofty, especially inaccessible; by implication, safe, strong; used literally and figuratively

2.brief: to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

4.brief: properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush)

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
an encountering, accidental, friendly or hostile (also adverbially, opposite)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

5.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

6.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
a dog; hence (by euphemism) a male prostitute
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)

7.brief: to gush forth; figuratively, to utter (good or bad words); specifically, to emit (a foul odor)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

8.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
to deride; by implication (as if imitating a foreigner) to speak unintelligibly
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts

near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab

10.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to be hostile (only active participle an opponent)

11.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to waver, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined)
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)

12.brief: an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere
literally a failure of flesh, i.e. emaciation; figuratively, hypocrisy
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate

13.brief: to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

cessation, i.e. an end (especially of the earth); often used adverb, no further; also the ankle (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or foot
